lead_paragraph: The payments to Joseph Percoco totaled at least $70,000 in 2014, when he split his time working for the state and for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s re-election effort.

byline.contributor: Vivian Yee contributed reporting, and Jack Begg contributed research.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

headline.print_headline: Records Say Ex-Cuomo Aide Was Paid by Companies With State Business
headline.main: Ex-Cuomo Aide Paid by Companies With State Business, Records Show

snippet: The payments to Joseph Percoco totaled at least $70,000 in 2014, when he split his time working for the state and for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s re-election effort.
abstract: Records show that Joseph Percoco, former senior aide and campaign manager to Gov Andrew M Cuomo who has been targeted by ethics investigation into improper lobbying and conflicts of interest, was paid at least $70,000 in 2014 by companies doing business with state.
